body:
> Only tiny thing I can think of is adding a test to verify that keys on the prototype aren't included in the keys operator, but not sure how valuable testing that would be.

It wouldn't hurt to test that. 

> Would it be beneficial to test a case in which a non-object is passed into keys, or a non-array into intersect?

Yes, we should ensure that they have sensical failure modes. I suspect we should either return empty lists or `undefined` when things go bad.

Assigning back to myself to add tests for this stuff.
body_text:
Only tiny thing I can think of is adding a test to verify that keys on the prototype aren't included in the keys operator, but not sure how valuable testing that would be.

It wouldn't hurt to test that.

Would it be beneficial to test a case in which a non-object is passed into keys, or a non-array into intersect?

Yes, we should ensure that they have sensical failure modes. I suspect we should either return empty lists or undefined when things go bad.
Assigning back to myself to add tests for this stuff.
body_html:
Only tiny thing I can think of is adding a test to verify that keys on the prototype aren't included in the keys operator, but not sure how valuable testing that would be.

It wouldn't hurt to test that.

Would it be beneficial to test a case in which a non-object is passed into keys, or a non-array into intersect?

Yes, we should ensure that they have sensical failure modes. I suspect we should either return empty lists or undefined when things go bad.

Assigning back to myself to add tests for this stuff.
